caption: Your input image may contain content that is not allowed by our safety system.
title: In august, 1973 a major forest fire swept through 17,470 acres of the western slopes of the sierra mountain range near Sonora.  In post-fire salvage operations, "cat skinnes" work in dust of caterpillar tractors.  The "cats" haul logs of fire-damaged trees to "landing" where they are loaded onto trucks for transporting out of the area.  Soot and ashes from fire are so thick that drivers must wear face masks
